metadata.description: Complete IELTS Speaking topics with questions for Part 1, Part 2, and Part 3
metadata.usage: Import these into your database using bulk create or seed data

topic.title: Work
topic.description: Questions about your job, career, and workplace

questions.questionText: What do you do? / What is your job?
What are your main responsibilities at work?
Do you like your job? Why or why not?
What do you like most about your job?
Is there anything you don't like about your job?
What time do you usually start work?
How do you get to work?
Did you have to do much training for your job?
What did you want to be when you were younger?
Do you plan to continue doing this job in the future?
What's the most important thing about a job for you?
Would you recommend your job to others?

topic.title: Study
topic.description: Questions about your education and studies

questions.questionText: What are you studying?
Why did you choose this subject?
Do you enjoy studying this subject?
What's your favorite subject?
What do you find most difficult about studying?
Do you prefer to study alone or with others?
Where do you usually study?
What time of day do you prefer to study?
What do you plan to do after you finish your studies?
Would you like to study abroad?

topic.title: Hometown
topic.description: Questions about where you live and your local area

questions.questionText: Where are you from?
What's your hometown like?
What do you like most about your hometown?
Is there anything you don't like about it?
How long have you lived there?
Do you think you will live there in the future?
What's the most interesting part of your town/city?
Has your hometown changed much in recent years?
Would you recommend your hometown to visitors?
What kind of jobs do people do in your hometown?

topic.title: Family
topic.description: Questions about your family and relatives

questions.questionText: Tell me about your family.
Do you have a large family or a small family?
How much time do you spend with your family?
What do you like to do together as a family?
Who are you closest to in your family?
Do you get along well with your family?
Are people in your country generally close to their families?
Is family important in your culture?
Would you prefer to have a big family or a small family?
Do you often see your relatives?

topic.title: Hobbies
topic.description: Questions about your interests and leisure activities

questions.questionText: What do you like to do in your free time?
Do you have any hobbies?
How long have you had this hobby?
How did you become interested in this hobby?
What hobbies are popular in your country?
Do you think it's important to have hobbies?
How much time do you spend on your hobbies?
Is there a hobby you would like to try in the future?
Do you prefer indoor or outdoor hobbies?
Have your hobbies changed since you were a child?

topic.title: Food
topic.description: Questions about food, cooking, and eating habits

questions.questionText: What's your favorite food?
Do you like cooking?
What foods are popular in your country?
Do you prefer eating at home or in restaurants?
Did you like the same food when you were a child?
Is there any food you don't like?
Do you think your diet is healthy?
Have you ever tried foreign food?
What's a typical meal in your country?
Would you like to learn how to cook better?

part2_question.questionText:
Describe a person you admire.

You should say:
• who this person is
• how you know this person
• what this person is like
• and explain why you admire this person

part3_questions.questionText: What qualities make someone a good role model?
Do you think celebrities have a responsibility to be role models?
How has the concept of role models changed over time?
In what ways can parents influence their children?
Should successful people share their experiences with others?

part2_question.questionText:
Describe a family member you are close to.

You should say:
• who this person is
• what your relationship is like
• what you do together
• and explain why you are close to this person

part3_questions.questionText: How important is family in your culture?
Have family relationships changed in modern society?
What are the benefits of living in an extended family?
How can families maintain strong relationships?
Do you think family bonds are weaker than in the past?

part2_question.questionText:
Describe a good friend of yours.

You should say:
• who this person is
• how you met
• what you like about them
• and explain why this person is important to you

part3_questions.questionText: What qualities make a good friend?
Is it easy to make friends in your country?
How have social media changed friendships?
Can online friendships be as meaningful as real-life ones?
Why do people sometimes lose touch with old friends?

part2_question.questionText:
Describe a teacher who has influenced you.

You should say:
• who this teacher is
• what subject they taught
• how they influenced you
• and explain why they were important to you

part3_questions.questionText: What makes a good teacher?
Should teachers be paid more?
How has teaching changed with technology?
Is online education as effective as traditional teaching?
What role should teachers play in students' lives?

part2_question.questionText:
Describe a place you visited that you found interesting.

You should say:
• where it is
• when you went there
• what you did there
• and explain why you found it interesting

part3_questions.questionText: Why do people like to travel?
How has tourism affected your country?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of tourism?
Do you think mass tourism damages local culture?
How will travel change in the future?

part2_question.questionText:
Describe your hometown.

You should say:
• where it is
• what it's famous for
• what you like about it
• and explain whether you would recommend it to visitors

part3_questions.questionText: How have cities changed in recent years?
What problems do large cities face?
Is it better to live in a city or the countryside?
How can cities be made more livable?
Will more people move to cities in the future?

note: Đây là 6 topics mẫu. File đầy đủ sẽ có 100 topics. Bạn có muốn tôi tiếp tục tạo thêm 94 topics nữa không?
